toolTip.value: Set Entity Rendering

name.value: Render by entity IRI short name (Id)

toolTip.value: Render entity by IRI (path element or fragment)
Render entity by prefixed name e.g. owl:Thing
Render entity by the values of rdfs:label
Render entity by the values of an annotation property
Open the rendering configuration panel
Display axiom annotations inline
Display datatypes on annotation values
Display thumbnail images for annotation values that are image URLs
Display deprecated entities in the currently focused view
Display relationships in the class hierarchy
Show a breadcrumb trail for the current selection
Only the active ontology is visible

name.value: Show the imports closure of the active ontology

toolTip.value: Ontologies that are in the imports closure of the active ontology are visible
All loaded ontologies are visible
Expand all nodes in the focused tree

name.value: Render by Entity IRI short name (Id)
Render by annotation property (e.g., rdfs:label, skos:prefLabel)

toolTip.value: Open an ontology from a URL
Undo the last set of changes
Redo the last set of changes
Collects together all loaded ontologies in a particular folder without modifying the originals
Exports inferred axioms as an ontology
Reload the active ontology
Search open ontologies
Find an entity in the focused view

name.value: Copy sub-hierarchy as tab indented text

toolTip.value: Copy the sub-hierarchy of the selection to the clipboard as tab indented text
Duplicates the current class. This copies the class, its superclasses and equivalent classes.
Create a new object in the selected view
Create a child of the selected object in the selected view
Create a sibling of the selected object in the selected view
Converts the equivalent classes of the selected class to superclasses.
Converts the superclasses of the selected class to an equivalent class.
Makes primitive sibling classes disjoint. All disjoint axioms are added to the current ontology.
Makes primitive sibling classes disjoint. All disjoint axioms are added to the current ontology.
Removes all DifferentIndividuals axioms and adds one DifferentIndividuals axiom containing all individuals in the signature of the active ontologies.
Makes the individuals that are instances the selected class different individuals. This only changes the active ontology.

Adds a covering axiom to the selected class. If a class A has subclassses B, C and D then the covering axiom for A is the union class (B or C or D). This forces all instances of A to be a member of one of its subclasses.
Removes all of the disjoint classes axioms that reference subclasses of the selected class.
Removes all of the disjoint classes axioms in the active ontologies
Deprecates the selected entity
View, add and edit the active ontology catalog (catalog.xml file)
View, add and edit an ontology catalog file
Shows the physical URLs from where currently loaded ontologies were obtained from
Invoke and configure reasoners
Refactor the ontology, or the selected class, property or individual
Deletes the selection in the focused view
Change the IRI of the selected entity
Change the IRI of entities using search and replace
Change the IRI of the active ontology
Change the IRI of all entities to an ID and move the name to a label annotation on the entity as per settings in the New Entity preferences

name.value: Convert property assertion on class/individual puns to annotations

toolTip.value: Converts any property assertions with a subject which is a pun to an annotation on the class which is punned

name.value: Coerce data property values into property range

toolTip.value: Coerces any data property value into (to be typed by) the range of the data property
Splits subclass axioms in the active ontologies into more fine grained axioms. For example, A subClassOf (B and C) would be split into A subClassOf B, and A subClassOf C
Merges subclass axioms that have a common left hand side. For example, A subClassOf B, A subClassOf C would be merged into a single subclass axiom, A subClassOf (B and C).

name.value: Split disjoint classes into pairwise disjoints

toolTip.value: Splits disjoint classes axioms in the active ontologies into pairwise disjoints to aid backwards compatibility. For example, disjointClasses(A, B, C) would be split into A disjointWith B, A disjointWith C, B disjointWith C

name.value: Amalgamate disjoint classes into larger disjoint sets

toolTip.value: Merges disjoint classes axioms in the active ontologies into more efficient sets. For example, A disjointWith B, A disjointWith C, B disjointWith C would be merged into disjointClasses(A, B, C)
Merge one or more ontologies into an existing or new ontology.

name.value: Convert qualified min cardinality 1 to someValuesFrom

toolTip.value: Finds all uses of qualified min cardinality 1 restrictions and replaces them with someValuesFrom restrictions.
Extract/select axioms from an ontology and optionally move them to another ontology
Shows the usage of the selected entity
Creates a class hierarchy from tab indented text, and inserts the new hierarchy into the existing class hierarchy below the current selection.
Creates an object property hierarchy from tab indented text, and inserts the new hierarchy into the existing object property hierarchy below the current selection.
Creates a data property hierarchy from tab indented text, and inserts the new hierarchy into the existing data property hierarchy below the current selection.
Find plugins in the Prot\u00E9g\u00E9 Wiki plugin library
Documentation for the Class Expression Syntax used in Prot\u00E9g\u00E9

name.value: Axioms by reference (select entities from the ontology)
Axioms by type (eg subclass axioms, annotation axioms)
Axioms by profile (select axioms in a sublanguage of OWL)
Axioms by definition (select axioms that define entities)

toolTip.value: Add a subclass of the selected class
Add a sibling of the selected class
Change the IRI of the selected class
Converts the equivalent classes of the selected class to superclasses.
Converts the superclasses of the selected class to an equivalent class.

name.value: Remove disjoint classes axioms for subclasses...

toolTip.value: Removes all of the disjoint classes axioms that mention subclasses of the selected class.

name.value: Copy sub-hierarchy as tab indented text

toolTip.value: Copy the sub-hierarchy of the selection to the clipboard as tab indented text
Duplicates the current class. This copies the class, its superclasses and equivalent classes.
Adds a sub-hierarchy below the selected class created from tab indented text
Adds a sub-hierarchy below the selected object property created from tab indented text
Adds a sub-hierarchy below the selected data property created from tab indented text
